roleset.name: to harm or spoil, damaging, destructive, causing harm

example.name: transitive
example.text: `` The events of April through June damaged the respect and confidence which most Americans previously had [] for the leaders of China . ''
example.arg: The events of April through June
respect and confidence which most Americans previously had [] for the leaders of China

example.name: passive with adverbials
example.text: Prices rose on the news that a sizable West German refinery was damaged [*]in a fire , [*] tightening an already tight European market .
example.arg: tightening an already tight European market

example.name: light-verb
example.text: A single 155mm round doesn't do any significant damage.

example.name: with CXN
example.text: Hillary Clinton is about as damaging to the Dem Party as Jeremiah Wright .

example.name: Cricket goals as instrument
example.text: A powerful Maxwell propped up Australia's run rate and took the score past 240 and finished unbeaten on 29 off 22 balls, he was damaging with two sixes and a four.
example.arg: with two sixes and a four.

example.name: Arg1 only
example.text: I stop the multivitamin and my mouth symptoms are gone , sadly my eyesight is still damaged .

example.name: Both args
example.text: The spinal cord is damaged from the impact of the disk contacting the spinal cord.
example.arg: from the impact of the disk contacting the spinal cord.

roleset.note: DAMAGE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'damage' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from damage.01-v predicate notes)
DAMAGE-N NOTES: Corresponds with damage.01 (from damage.01-n)
DAMAGING-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, damage-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls destroy-44. (from damaging.01-j)

DAMAGED-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. Based on verb entry damage.01, but differs in that adj lacks arg2, which doesn't seem grammatical with adjective usages. (from damaged.01-j)
